intro: Erigeron tener, commonly known as the woolly fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its soft, fuzzy leaves and daisy-like white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads. Erigeron tener is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
